column4: random: can anyone help me with rc.d? and further explain what it is
i have rc1.d up to 6.d but no actual 'rc.d'. do i need it?
can anyone help me with rc.d?
No, you only need rc1.d rc2.d rc3.d
What are you trying to do?
and a script relies on rc.d
i was wondering if i coudl just edit the script to one of hte numbers
What do you need to do?
k. does it matter which number i use?
i am trying to set up a socket policy file
It only orders them, (order in which they are run)
k so it doesnt really matter which number i use then i guess.. yea?
If you'll notice, rc2.d and rc3.d are same, so if you put what you want in rc2.d, that's prbably all you need to do.
